definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
a device used to check money and detect counterfeit bills
false paper money burned as an offering to the dead
money counter and counterfeit detection machine

sentences.english: The central bank issued a commemorative 10-yuan bank note to mark the Beijing Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 央行爲紀念北京奧運會將發行10圓面值的紀念鈔。

sentences.english: And after this had happened several times, people stopped employing him as a copyist.
sentences.chinese: 如是幾次，叫他鈔書的人也沒有了。

sentences.english: My watch is five seconds slow.
Break this big bill into small change.
There is A Copy of Libai's Poems selected and copied by my great grandfather himself at my home.
sentences.chinese: 我家有一本太祖爺爺自己選編並抄寫的《李白詩鈔》。

sentences.english: It's ALL government spending and paper-money printing, wherever you look.
sentences.chinese: 隨你怎麼想，其實就是政府多印鈔，多花錢。

sentences.english: Traditional counting head damages note and can't count plastic note accurately.
sentences.chinese: 傳統數鈔頭損傷鈔票並且塑料鈔計數不準確。

sentences.english: Inflation is being broke with a lot of money in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 通貨膨脹即是囊中多鈔而沒有錢花。

sentences.english: Traditional counting head damages easily the banknote and can′t count plastic notes accurately.
sentences.chinese: 傳統數鈔頭損傷鈔票並且塑料鈔計數不準確。
